I think I have just the thing for you! Since you're interested in a story about assassination, I'd recommend "The Trouble with Harry" (1955). It's a classic black comedy that follows a group of people trying to figure out what happened to Harry, who's been killed and left in the woods. With Alfred Hitchcock at the helm, you can expect clever direction and witty performances from the cast.

If you're open to something a bit more light-hearted, "Anyone But You" (1996) is another great option that explores themes of attraction and relationships.

If you're looking for a movie that shares some of the same woods-based intrigue as "In the Woods", I'd suggest checking out "Training Day" instead. This gritty thriller features Denzel Washington in a critically acclaimed performance, and its tense atmosphere and surprise twists will keep you on the edge of your seat.

That being said, if you're open to something a bit more lighthearted, "Waiting" is also an entertaining choice. With a talented cast, including Ethan Hawke and Snoop Dogg, this comedy-drama explores themes of family and relationships in a fun and quirky way.

Directed by Brian Gibson (who's not involved in this film, but that's a story), it's a gripping retelling of the Pearl Harbor attacks. The all-star cast brings to life the events leading up to and following the tragic event.

If you're in the mood for something a bit more romantic, "A Farewell to Arms" is a classic love story set against the backdrop of World War I. It's a beautifully shot film with a poignant narrative that explores the human side of war.
